Citations.Cited_Guidance: If an interventional model indicates a cross-over, parallel or factorial design then more than 1 intervention is expected.

rule.Check:
($.study.versions)@$sv.
  ($sv.studyDesigns[studyType.code = "C98388"])@$sd.
    {
      "instanceType": $sd.instanceType,
      "id": $sd.id,
      "path": $sd._path,
      "name": $sd.name,
      "studyType.code": $sd.studyType.code,
      "studyType.decode": $sd.studyType.decode,
      "model.code": $sd.model.code,
      "model.decode": $sd.model.decode,
      "# Referenced Study Interventions":  $count($distinct($sd.studyInterventionIds[$ in $sv.studyInterventions.id]))
    }
    [
      (`model.code` in ["C82637","C82639","C82638"] and `# Referenced Study Interventions` <= 1)
    ]
rule.Description: If an interventional model indicates a cross-over, parallel or factorial design then more than 1 intervention is expected.

Outcome.Message: The number of study interventions referenced for the interventional study design is not consistent with intervention model specified for the study design - the model indicates a cross-over, parallel or factorial design (model.code is C82637, C82639, or C82638) and there are not references to multiple study interventions.
